```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(reticulate)

venv_path <- "python_env"

if (!virtualenv_exists(venv_path)) {
  message("Creating virtual environment...")
  tryCatch({
    virtualenv_create(venv_path)
    virtualenv_install(venv_path, packages = c("numpy", "pandas", "matplotlib"))
  }, error = function(e) {
    install_python()
    virtualenv_create(venv_path)
    virtualenv_install(venv_path, packages = c("numpy", "pandas", "matplotlib"))
  })
}

use_virtualenv(venv_path, required = TRUE)
```

# Presentation Template
## Getting Started Guide

### Your Name Here
### `r Sys.Date()`

---

# File Structure

**Project Organization:**

```
your-project/
├── presentation.Rmd          # This file
├── styles/
│   └── custom.css            # Styling
├── assets/
│   └── images/               # Your logos
```

**Note:** The `python_env/` folder is auto-created on first knit (2-3 min).

---

# Quick Start

**Step 1:** Edit YAML Header

```yaml
title: "Your Presentation Title"
author: "Your Name"
```

**Step 2:** Edit the `layout: true` section to change header/footer

**Step 3:** Use `---` to create new slides!

---

# Text Formatting

**Bold:** `**text**` → **bold**

*Italic:* `*text*` → *italic*

`Code:` backticks → `inline code`

---

# Lists

.pull-left[
**Unordered:**
- Item 1
- Item 2
  - Nested item
]

.pull-right[
**Ordered:**
1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item
]

# Two-Column Layout

.pull-left[
## Left Column

Use `.pull-left[...]`

- Comparisons
- Side-by-side content
]

.pull-right[
## Right Column

Use `.pull-right[...]`

- Complementary info
- Code + output
]

# Math Equations

**Inline:** $E = mc^2$ appears within text.

.pull-left[
**Expected Value:**

$$\mathbb{E}(X) = \sum_{i=1}^{n} x_i \cdot p(x_i)$$
]

.pull-right[
**Derivative:**

$$\frac{\partial f}{\partial x} = \lim_{h \to 0} \frac{f(x+h) - f(x)}{h}$$
]

# R Visualization

.pull-left[
```{r r-plot, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, 
                   color = factor(cyl))) +
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  labs(title = "Weight vs MPG",
       x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",
       y = "MPG", color = "Cyl") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 10) +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r r-plot-out, echo=FALSE, fig.height=5, fig.width=6}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, 
                   color = factor(cyl))) +
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  labs(title = "Weight vs MPG",
       x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",
       y = "MPG", color = "Cyl") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 10) +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")
```
]

---

# R Box Plot

.pull-left[
```{r r-box, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, 
                 y = Sepal.Length, 
                 fill = Species)) +
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.7) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2, alpha = 0.3) +
  labs(title = "Sepal Length by Species",
       x = "Species",
       y = "Sepal Length (cm)") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 10) +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2")
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r r-box-out, echo=FALSE, fig.height=5, fig.width=6}
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, 
                 y = Sepal.Length, 
                 fill = Species)) +
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.7) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2, alpha = 0.3) +
  labs(title = "Sepal Length by Species",
       x = "Species",
       y = "Sepal Length (cm)") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 10) +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2")
```
]

# Python Code Example

```{python py-basic}
import numpy as np

numbers = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
print(f"Mean: {numbers.mean():.2f}")
print(f"Std Dev: {numbers.std():.2f}")
```

# Python Visualization

.pull-left[
```{python py-plot, eval=FALSE}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y1, y2 = np.sin(x), np.cos(x)

plt.figure(figsize=(5, 4))
plt.plot(x, y1, label='sin(x)', lw=2)
plt.plot(x, y2, label='cos(x)', lw=2)
plt.xlabel('X')
plt.ylabel('Y')
plt.title('Sine and Cosine')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```
]

.pull-right[
```{python py-plot-out, echo=FALSE, fig.height=5, fig.width=6}

import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y1, y2 = np.sin(x), np.cos(x)

plt.plot(x, y2, label='cos(x)', lw=2)
plt.xlabel('X')
plt.ylabel('Y')
plt.title('Sine and Cosine')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```

# Python Scatter Plot

.pull-left[
```{python py-scatter, eval=FALSE}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

np.random.seed(42)
n = 100
x = np.random.randn(n)
y = 2 * x + np.random.randn(n)
colors = np.random.rand(n)

plt.figure(figsize=(5, 4))
plt.scatter(x, y, c=colors, s=50, 
            alpha=0.6, cmap='viridis')
plt.colorbar(label='Value')
plt.xlabel('X')
plt.ylabel('Y')
plt.title('Scatter Plot')
plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```
]

.pull-right[
```{python py-scatter-out, echo=FALSE, fig.height=5, fig.width=6}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

np.random.seed(42)
```

# Code Chunk Options

| Option | Effect |
|--------|--------|
| `echo=TRUE` | Show code and output |
| `echo=FALSE` | Hide code, show output |
| `eval=FALSE` | Show code, don't run |
| `include=FALSE` | Run silently |

# Tips

1. **Keep slides simple** - One idea per slide
2. **Use visuals** - Charts over tables
3. **Limit text** - Bullets, not paragraphs
4. **Test math** - No blank lines around `$$`
